DOC.brief_summary: Project 2 of the University of California, San Diego (UCSD) American Heart Association (AHA) Women's Health Program will assess 3-month changes in sitting time, standing time, physical activity and blood pressure in a randomized control trial. This 2-arm randomized controlled trial (RCT) will occur in the community with post menopausal Latina women (N=250) who spend at least 8 hrs/day sitting and have increased risk for cardiovascular disease through high BMI and borderline hypertension. Women will be identified through the San Ysidro Health Clinic and assessed at the South Bay Latino Research Center.
DOC.brief_title: Trial to Reduce Sitting Time in Postmenopausal Latina Women at Increased Risk for Heart Disease
DOC.detailed_description: Project 2 will address the following aims: 1. Investigate the 3 month effect of the intervention to impact the primary behavioral outcomes of sitting, standing and stepping time assessed objectively by a thigh worn inclinometer (ActivPAL) in Latinas at risk for heart disease. 2. Investigate the 3 month effect of the intervention to impact the secondary health outcomes of blood pressure, depressive symptoms, and anthropometrics. 3. Explore the psychosocial & environmental mediators & moderators of changes in sitting time.
DOC.criteria: 1. Female with no menstruation for at least 1 year, and 55 years of age or older 2. Selfidentify as Hispanic ethnicity, 3. Able to read English or Spanish, 4. Able to walk or stand for short periods of time, 5. Have no medical conditions that would affect your ability to participate, 6. Have slightly high blood pressure (systolic blood pressure (SBP) between 120 and 139 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure (DBP) between 80 and 89 mmHg), 7. Have phone access (to receive counseling calls), 8. Have Body Mass Index in the range of 2745 kg/m2, 9. Sit for more than 8 hours on most days and walk less than 8000 steps each day as measured by a small thigh worn device, 10. Are not participating in another related research study. 1. Unable to complete the Short Physical Performance Battery. 2. Mental states that would preclude complete understanding of the protocol and compliance. 3. Chronic illness that may be associated with weight change (HIV/AIDS, active cancer, or uncontrolled thyroid disease). 4. Body Mass Index <27.0 or >45.0kg/m2. 5. Arthritis or degenerative joint disease affecting knees if repeated sitting/standing interruptions might cause pain. 6. Type 1 diabetes mellitus 7. Hypertension (SBP ≥140 mmHg or DBP ≥90 mmHg). 8. Weight instability in past 3 months (no more than 5% up or down). 9. Participants <65 years of age with HbA1c ≥53 mmol/mol (7%) and participants ≥65 years of age with HbA1c ≥58mmol/mol (7.5%) will be excluded for uncontrolled diabetes.34,35 10. Use of insulin medications. 11. Use of any immunosuppressant or corticosteroid medication. 12. Use of medications that might cause weight change (e.g., second generation antipsychotics). 13. ≤ 8hr average daily sitting time, as measured by ActivPAL. 14. ≥8000 steps/day average, as measured by ActivPAL 15. Participating in another clinical trial related to study outcomes (as determined by the PI). 16. Smoking cigarettes or anything, and other use of tobacco products. 17. Chronic Venous Insufficiency resulting in discomfort when standing for 5 minutes.
